job.name: Complete_File_Listener_Job_Action_Example

variable.name: SERVER_TO_MONITOR
variable.description: Hostname or IP address of the server to be monitored

variable.name: SOURCE_FOLDER_PATH
variable.description: Folder on the given server that will be monitored for new files presence

variable.name: FILENAME_PATTERN
variable.description: Only filenames which match the supplied regular expression are be considered

variable.name: ACTION_WORKFLOW
variable.description: Workflow action to submit from the Catalog

variable.name: DELETE_DETECTED_FILE
variable.description: A boolean indicating whether to delete the detected file after the workflow action. Default value is False.

variable.name: DESTINATION_FOLDER_PATH
variable.description: Path of the folder on the given TARGET HOST where the file be transferred.

variable.name: IF_FILE_EXISTS_AT_DESTINATION
variable.description: Choose the action to perform in case the found file exists at destination. Default value is Replace.

variable.name: SFTP_HOST
variable.description: Hostname or IP address of the SFTP server. Default value is localhost

variable.name: FTP_HOST
variable.description: Hostname or IP address of the FTP server. Default value is localhost

variable.name: POSTGRESQL_DATABASE
variable.description: The database name

variable.name: FOLDER_DESTINATION_SETTINGS_HANDLER
variable.model: PA:SPEL(variables['ACTION_WORKFLOW'] == 'event-file-listener/Folder_To_Folder_File_Transfer_Task' ? showGroup('Folder Destination Settings') : hideGroup('Folder Destination Settings'))
variable.description: Handler which enables the variables of the Folder Destination Settings group based on the chosen ACTION_WORKFLOW

variable.name: SFTP_PORT
variable.description: The listening port of the SFTP server. Default value is 22

variable.name: SFTP_USERNAME
variable.description: SFTP server user name

variable.name: SFTP_CREDENTIAL_KEY
variable.description: Third-party credential storing the password associated with the given user name

variable.name: SFTP_DESTINATION_FOLDER_PATH
variable.description: The remote relative path on the SFTP server where transferred file(s) will be stored.

variable.name: SFTP_DESTINATION_SETTINNGS_HANDLER
variable.model: PA:SPEL(variables['ACTION_WORKFLOW'] == 'event-file-listener/SFTP_File_Transfer_Task' ? showGroup('SFTP Destination Settings') : hideGroup('SFTP Destination Settings'))
variable.description: Handler which enables the variables of the SFTP Destination Settings group based on the chosen ACTION_WORKFLOW

variable.name: FTP_DESTINATION_SETTINGS_HANDLER
variable.model: PA:SPEL(variables['ACTION_WORKFLOW'] == 'event-file-listener/FTP_File_Transfer_Task' ? showGroup('FTP Destination Settings') : hideGroup('FTP Destination Settings'))
variable.description: Handler which enables the variables of the FTP Destination Settings group based on the chosen ACTION_WORKFLOW

variable.name: FTP_PORT
variable.description: The listening port of the FTP server. Default value is 21

variable.name: FTP_USERNAME
variable.description: FTP server user name

variable.name: FTP_CREDENTIAL_KEY
variable.description: Third-party credential storing the password associated with the given user name

variable.name: FTP_DESTINATION_FOLDER_PATH
variable.description: The remote relative path on the FTP server where transferred file(s) will be stored.

variable.name: POSTGRESQL_HOST
variable.description: Hostname or IP address of the database host machine. Default value is localhost

variable.name: POSTGRESQL_PORT
variable.description: The listening port of the database. Default value is 5432

variable.name: POSTGRESQL_USERNAME
variable.description: Database user name

variable.name: POSTGRESQL_CREDENTIAL_KEY
variable.description: Third-party credential storing the password associated with the given user name

variable.name: POSTGRESQL_DESTINATION_SETTINGS_HANDLER
variable.model: PA:SPEL(variables['ACTION_WORKFLOW'] == 'event-file-listener/Postgres_File_Export_Task' ? showGroup('PostgreSQL Destination Settings') : hideGroup('PostgreSQL Destination Settings'))
variable.description: Handler which enables the variables of the PostgreSQL Destination Settings group based on the chosen ACTION_WORKFLOW

variable.name: FREQUENCY
variable.description: If the until success option is selected, the file listener stops listening to the folder when the listener rules are met. Otherwise, the file listener notifies the registered application on events and continues to listen for subsequent events.

variable.name: POLLING_INTERVAL
variable.description: The time window (minutes) between two checking for the presence of new files arrival. A value of 0 means that the listener is reactive.

variable.name: START_NOW
variable.description: If true, the file listener will be activated immediately.

variable.name: START_DATE
variable.description: Select a specific date to activate the file listener

variable.name: DAYS_TO_RUN
variable.description: Number of days the file listener is running.

variable.name: HOURS_TO_RUN
variable.description: Number of hours the file listener is running.

variable.name: MINUTES_TO_RUN
variable.description: Number of minutes the file listener is running.

variable.name: END_DATE
variable.description: Select a specific date until which the file listener runs

variable.name: START_DATE_HANDLER
variable.description: Handler which shows START_DATE in case START_NOW value is false

variable.name: END_DATE_HANDLER
variable.model: PA:SPEL(variables['DAYS_TO_RUN'] == '0' && variables['HOURS_TO_RUN'] == '0' && variables['MINUTES_TO_RUN'] == '0' ? showVar('END_DATE') && hideVar('DAYS_TO_RUN') && hideVar('HOURS_TO_RUN') && hideVar('MINUTES_TO_RUN') : hideVar('END_DATE'))
variable.description: Handler which shows START_DATE based on DAYS and HOURS values

variable.name: CHECK_SUB-FOLDERS
variable.description: A boolean indicating whether to seek files in sub-folders under the folder to monitor you specified

job.description:
This file listener workflow monitors a folder (`SOURCE_FOLDER_PATH`) on a given server (`SERVER_TO_MONITOR`). A file event is detected when a new file matching a specific pattern (`FILENAME_PATTERN`) arrives to this folder or an existing one is modified. For each new file detected, the file listener will submit a workflow action (`ACTION_WORKFLOW`) saved in the Catalog to the scheduler to process the file. The user is able to select a single workflow action among four options via a drop-down list. The default workflow action is a folder to folder file transfer.
The file listener can be interactively terminated by sending the Terminate\_Monitoring signal.

task.name: File_Listener
task.description:
This file listener workflow monitors a folder (SOURCE_FOLDER_PATH) on a given server (SERVER_TO_MONITOR). A file event is detected when a new file matching a specific pattern (FILENAME_PATTERN) arrives to this folder or an existing one is modified. For each new file detected, the file listener will submit a workflow action (ACTION_WORKFLOW) saved in the Catalog to the scheduler to process the file.
The file listener can be interactively terminated by sending the Terminate_Monitoring signal.

task.name: End_File_Listner
task.description: Clean up the synchronization api channel used by this workflow.

task.name: Init_File_Listener
task.description: Create the synchronization api channel used by this workflow.

script.code: if(!variables.get("SERVER_TO_MONITOR")){ throw new Exception("ERROR: SERVER_TO_MONITOR variable is not provided by the user") } channelId = "FileTrigger_" + variables.get("PA_JOB_ID") variables.put("CHANNEL_ID", channelId) synchronizationapi.createChannel(channelId, true) signalapi.readyForSignal("Terminate_Monitoring")

task.name: Init_Source_Settings
task.description: Configure the following listener rules: Server Environment: Host that contains the Agent on which file listener runs. Source Folder Path: Path to the folder to which the file listener listens.

script.code: sourceFolderPath = variables.get("SOURCE_FOLDER_PATH") serverEnvironment = variables.get("SERVER_TO_MONITOR") println("Monitoring the folder : " + sourceFolderPath + " located in the server host : " + serverEnvironment)

task.name: Init_File_Pattern
task.description: Specify a file name pattern, using wildcard characters, to decide which files will trigger the file listener.

script.code: println ("The file name pattern that triggers the file listener is : " + variables.get("FILENAME_PATTERN"))

task.name: Init_Frequency
task.description: Configure the file listener to run either on a reoccurring basis with a configurable polling interval or to stop listening to the folder when the listener rules are met.

task.name: Init_Schedule
task.description: Set the schedule options to start and end a file listener on a specific date and time, and seconds.

script.code:
import java.time.ZonedDateTime import java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter
startNow = variables.get("START_NOW").toBoolean() startDate = ZonedDateTime.now() if(!startNow){ startDate = ZonedDateTime.parse(variables.get("START_DATE")) } daysToRun = Integer.parseInt(variables.get("DAYS_TO_RUN")) hoursToRun = Integer.parseInt(variables.get("HOURS_TO_RUN")) minutesToRun = Integer.parseInt(variables.get("MINUTES_TO_RUN")) endDate = startDate.plusDays(daysToRun).plusHours(hoursToRun).plusMinutes(minutesToRun) if(daysToRun == 0 && hoursToRun == 0 && minutesToRun == 0){ endDate = variables.get("END_DATE") } println("The file listener is scheduled to listen to files on a defined location from the start date " + startDate.format(DateTimeFormatter.ISO_ZONED_DATE_TIME) + " until the end date " + endDate.format(DateTimeFormatter.ISO_OFFSET_DATE_TIME))
variables.put("START_DATE", startDate.format(DateTimeFormatter.ISO_OFFSET_DATE_TIME)) variables.put("END_DATE", endDate.format(DateTimeFormatter.ISO_OFFSET_DATE_TIME))

task.name: Init_Sub_Folders
task.description: Indicate whether to recursively search for files in sub-folders of the folder to be monitored. Default value is true.

script.code: println ("The search for files in sub-folders of the folder to be monitored is : " + variables.get("CHECK_SUB-FOLDERS"))

metadata.visualization:
File_Listener  
 End_File_Listner  
 Init_File_Listener  
 Init_Source_Settings  
 Init_File_Pattern  
 Init_Frequency  
 Init_Schedule  
 Init_Sub_Folders  
loop
